data:
1
00:00:16,099 --> 00:00:18,310
First, there was darkness.

2
00:00:19,853 --> 00:00:22,689
Then came the Strangers.

3
00:00:22,689 --> 00:00:25,484
They were a race
as old as time itself.

4
00:00:26,527 --> 00:00:29,238
They had mastered
the ultimate technology--

5
00:00:29,279 --> 00:00:34,535
the ability to alter
physical reality by will alone.

6
00:00:34,576 --> 00:00:37,204
They called this ability
"Tuning."

7
00:00:38,372 --> 00:00:40,249
But they were dying.

8
00:00:40,290 --> 00:00:43,335
Their civilization was
in decline,

9
00:00:43,335 --> 00:00:46,088
and so they abandoned
their world,

10
00:00:46,171 --> 00:00:48,841
seeking a cure
for their own mortality.

11
00:00:50,217 --> 00:00:53,679
Their endless journey brought
them to a small, blue world...

12
00:00:53,720 --> 00:00:55,848
in the farthest corner
of the galaxy.

13
00:00:56,890 --> 00:00:58,350
Our world.

14
00:00:59,393 --> 00:01:01,395
Here, they thought
they had finally found...

15
00:01:01,436 --> 00:01:03,355
what they had been
searching for.

16
00:01:14,157 --> 00:01:17,035
My name is
Dr. Daniel Poe Schreber.

17
00:01:18,036 --> 00:01:19,705
I am just a man.

18
00:01:19,705 --> 00:01:22,541
I help the Strangers
conduct their experiments.

19
00:01:24,084 --> 00:01:26,211
I have betrayed my own kind.

20
00:04:53,585 --> 00:04:55,420
You are confused, aren't you?

21
00:04:55,420 --> 00:04:58,257
Frightened. That's all right.
I can help you.

22
00:04:58,257 --> 00:04:59,925
-Who is this?
-I'm a doctor.

23
00:04:59,967 --> 00:05:02,636
You must listen to me.
You have lost your memory.

24
00:05:02,678 --> 00:05:04,805
There was an experiment.
Something went wrong.

25
00:05:04,847 --> 00:05:07,015
Your memory was erased.
Do you understand me?

26
00:05:07,099 --> 00:05:09,142
No, I don't understand.
What's going on here?

27
00:05:09,142 --> 00:05:11,979
There are people coming for you
as we speak.

28
00:05:12,020 --> 00:05:14,273
Don't let them find you.
Leave now.

29
00:05:15,482 --> 00:05:17,651
Hello? Are you there?

30
00:05:59,818 --> 00:06:02,279
Hey, Mr. Murdoch,
the Automat called.

31
00:06:02,321 --> 00:06:03,822
Said you left your wallet there.

32
00:06:04,865 --> 00:06:08,493
I suggest you retrieve it, since
you only paid for three weeks,

33
00:06:08,535 --> 00:06:10,329
and they was up 10 minutes ago.

34
00:06:12,372 --> 00:06:13,874
I've been here three weeks?

35
00:06:13,874 --> 00:06:17,044
It's right there
in black and white, Mr. Murdoch.

36
00:06:17,085 --> 00:06:19,505
Day and date.

37
00:06:19,546 --> 00:06:22,841
We make our books like we make
our beds, all neat and tidy.

38
00:06:22,883 --> 00:06:25,886
-I'll take care of it later.
-See that you do.

39
00:06:25,928 --> 00:06:28,055
Only thing makes you a guest
in this joint...

40
00:06:28,096 --> 00:06:29,515
is cash on the barrelhead!

41
00:06:47,366 --> 00:06:50,077
House rules.
Three weeks is three weeks.

42
00:06:50,118 --> 00:06:52,663
No days off for good behavior.

43
00:07:03,590 --> 00:07:07,261
Mr. Murdoch, yes?
Where is he?

44
00:07:07,261 --> 00:07:10,764
He just left
not five minutes ago.

45
00:07:12,099 --> 00:07:13,892
Sleep now.

46
00:07:16,478 --> 00:07:20,482
When the rumba rhythm
start to play

47
00:07:20,524 --> 00:07:22,693
Dance with me

48
00:07:22,734 --> 00:07:25,779
Make me sway

49
00:07:25,779 --> 00:07:29,783
Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore

50
00:07:29,825 --> 00:07:32,035
Hold me close

51
00:07:32,077 --> 00:07:34,955
Sway me more

52
00:07:34,955 --> 00:07:39,251
Like a flower bending
in the breeze

53
00:07:39,293 --> 00:07:41,753
Bend with me

54
00:07:41,753 --> 00:07:44,590
Sway with ease

55
00:07:44,631 --> 00:07:48,594
When we dance,
you have a way with me

56
00:07:48,635 --> 00:07:51,138
Stay with me

57
00:07:51,138 --> 00:07:53,682
Sway with me

58
00:07:54,516 --> 00:07:58,520
Hey, sweetie, he said he was
your husband's doctor.

59
00:07:58,604 --> 00:08:00,105
He wanted to speak with you.

60
00:08:20,334 --> 00:08:21,585
Excuse me.

61
00:08:23,545 --> 00:08:25,130
-Doctor...
-Schreber.

62
00:08:25,172 --> 00:08:29,176
Please, won't you come in?
You must be Emma Murdoch.

63
00:08:30,511 --> 00:08:33,972
Thank you for coming to see me
on such short notice.

64
00:08:34,014 --> 00:08:35,474
What is this?

65
00:08:35,516 --> 00:08:39,061
A rather crude experiment
designed to further my studies.

66
00:08:39,144 --> 00:08:42,773
I don't understand. You say
you're my husband's doctor,

67
00:08:42,814 --> 00:08:45,359
but he never
mentioned you to me.

68
00:08:45,359 --> 00:08:48,195
The truth is, John has been
coming to see me...

69
00:08:48,237 --> 00:08:49,696
for quite some time.

70
00:08:49,696 --> 00:08:53,075
He had been grappling
with feelings of betrayal...

71
00:08:53,116 --> 00:08:56,161
stemming from
your marital difficulties.

72
00:08:56,203 --> 00:08:58,121
-John told you what happened.
-Yes.

73
00:08:59,498 --> 00:09:01,792
When was the last time
that you saw him?

74
00:09:01,834 --> 00:09:04,711
Three weeks ago.
He packed a suitcase.

75
00:09:04,753 --> 00:09:07,256
He was very angry at me.

76
00:09:07,339 --> 00:09:10,175
I understand how difficult
this must be for you,

77
00:09:10,217 --> 00:09:11,510
but for John's sake,

78
00:09:11,552 --> 00:09:14,513
I would like you to think of me
as your friend, Emma.

79
00:09:14,555 --> 00:09:18,225
It appears that John
has suffered a psychotic break.

80
00:09:18,267 --> 00:09:21,395
-Complete memory loss.
-You can't be serious.

81
00:09:21,436 --> 00:09:24,356
Oh, but I am.
He may be delusional.

82
00:09:24,398 --> 00:09:25,691
Even violent.

83
00:09:27,025 --> 00:09:30,988
If he were to contact you,
you must call me immediately.

84
00:09:31,029 --> 00:09:33,490
Wherever your husband is,
he is searching...

85
00:09:35,242 --> 00:09:36,451
For himself.

86
00:09:46,628 --> 00:09:50,549
Good evening, Mr. Murdoch.
It is Mr. Murdoch, isn't it?

87
00:09:51,466 --> 00:09:54,928
Mr. "J" something Murdoch?

88
00:09:58,265 --> 00:10:02,477
J. Murdoch. What's your name?
Justin? Jerry?

89
00:10:06,773 --> 00:10:08,859
My name's Jason Murdoch.
John Murdoch.

90
00:10:08,901 --> 00:10:11,486
Jake Murdoch. How's it going?
Hi. Jack Murdoch.

91
00:10:17,826 --> 00:10:19,578
Got to get a grip on myself.

92
00:10:43,685 --> 00:10:47,022
I told the guy,
cash on the barrelhead.

93
00:10:47,105 --> 00:10:50,400
I said, "Listen,
three weeks is three weeks."

94
00:10:50,442 --> 00:10:53,987
-Where's our lucky winner?
-Upstairs, sir. Room 614.

95
00:10:55,280 --> 00:10:56,615
The call girl.

96
00:11:01,245 --> 00:11:04,164
-Evening, Husselbeck.
-Inspector Bumstead.

97
00:11:04,164 --> 00:11:05,916
Your lace is untied.

98
00:11:07,167 --> 00:11:08,460
Sorry.

99
00:11:16,844 --> 00:11:18,470
Am I glad you're here, sir.

100
00:11:18,512 --> 00:11:21,139
They say Detective Walenski's
got the heebie-jeebies.

101
00:11:21,181 --> 00:11:23,350
Just take what they give me,
Husselbeck.

102
00:11:54,214 --> 00:11:56,758
-Thanks a lot.
-Excuse me.

103
00:11:59,219 --> 00:12:01,013
-Hello?
-Oh, it's you.

104
00:12:01,722 --> 00:12:04,391
-You left your wallet here.
-When did I do that?

105
00:12:04,433 --> 00:12:06,685
-When you was last here.
-When was that?

106
00:12:06,727 --> 00:12:10,063
When you left your wallet.
Expect me to remember?

107
00:12:15,903 --> 00:12:18,655
-Excuse me!
-No, no, seriously.

108
00:12:36,048 --> 00:12:37,883
-Where you headed, chief?
-Home.

109
00:12:37,925 --> 00:12:39,259
And where's home?

110
00:12:39,259 --> 00:12:42,054
Haven't you mugs got
anything better to do?

111
00:12:42,095 --> 00:12:44,389
I'm just doing my job, May.

112
00:12:44,431 --> 00:12:46,433
There's a killer out there.

113
00:12:46,475 --> 00:12:49,144
Look for him
instead of cooling your heels.

114
00:12:52,439 --> 00:12:54,191
Go on. Get out of here.

115
00:13:03,116 --> 00:13:04,201
Come on.

116
00:13:07,454 --> 00:13:10,249
What's that make so far?
Six hookers in all?

117
00:13:10,249 --> 00:13:13,168
-I believe so, sir.
-Give the man an "A" for effort.

118
00:13:18,590 --> 00:13:20,926
So, Husselbeck,

119
00:13:20,968 --> 00:13:27,432
what kind of killer do you think
stops to save a dying fish?

120
00:13:27,474 --> 00:13:29,309
-Got me, sir.
-Bumstead.

121
00:13:29,351 --> 00:13:32,646
What took you? This killer's
been running circles around us,

122
00:13:32,646 --> 00:13:33,772
thanks to Walenski.

123
00:13:33,814 --> 00:13:35,607
With all due respect,
Chief lnspector,

124
00:13:35,649 --> 00:13:38,735
I've known Eddie a long time,
and he's a good cop.

125
00:13:38,777 --> 00:13:40,988
Whatever kind of cop
Walenski once was...

126
00:13:40,988 --> 00:13:42,948
he let drift a long time ago.

127
00:13:42,990 --> 00:13:44,783
Let me talk to Bumstead!

128
00:13:44,825 --> 00:13:46,869
Come on! Hold on!

129
00:13:47,536 --> 00:13:48,704
Frank!

130
00:13:51,790 --> 00:13:53,834
-Get his arm !
-They're watching us!

131
00:13:53,876 --> 00:13:56,128
-On your feet!
-There's no way out!

132
00:13:57,546 --> 00:13:59,256
God, can't you see?

133
00:14:02,676 --> 00:14:05,012
Let me go!
I'm not going to hurt you.

134
00:14:06,555 --> 00:14:08,807
-What was that?
-Walenski.

135
00:14:17,149 --> 00:14:20,277
I'm being punished
for my sins, right?

136
00:14:20,319 --> 00:14:24,656
What did I ever do to inherit
this? Where do you begin?

137
00:14:24,656 --> 00:14:27,618
Well, everything Detective
Walenski committed to paper...

138
00:14:27,659 --> 00:14:29,077
should be here, so--

139
00:14:29,119 --> 00:14:31,747
The only thing that should be
committed is Walenski.

140
00:14:34,041 --> 00:14:35,918
Nothing like
a little healthy paranoia.

141
00:14:42,508 --> 00:14:45,844
I came here to file a missing
persons report for my husband.

142
00:14:45,844 --> 00:14:49,264
-Take it to the front desk.
-They told me to come see you.

143
00:14:51,558 --> 00:14:53,227
His name's John Murdoch.

144
00:14:56,230 --> 00:14:59,566
Do these names mean
anything to you?

145
00:15:00,442 --> 00:15:02,402
Who are these women?

146
00:15:02,444 --> 00:15:04,321
Why are you looking
for my husband?

147
00:15:04,363 --> 00:15:06,615
Are you going to accuse him
of something?

148
00:15:06,657 --> 00:15:10,202
-Maybe. Maybe murder.
-Whose murder?

149
00:15:11,620 --> 00:15:14,873
-Which one?
-All of them.

150
00:15:16,291 --> 00:15:19,586
Mrs. Murdoch, I am sorry.
I didn't mean to alarm you.

151
00:15:19,628 --> 00:15:22,381
I'm sorry that I came.
I just made a mistake.

152
00:15:22,422 --> 00:15:26,218
If you'd please just give me
half a second to explain.

153
00:15:35,602 --> 00:15:36,812
We met before?

154
00:15:38,438 --> 00:15:41,525
If we did,
I hope you're still breathing.

155
00:15:41,567 --> 00:15:43,110
What's your name, honey?

156
00:15:46,905 --> 00:15:48,699
Well, that's
an appropriate name.

157
00:15:56,623 --> 00:15:57,916
I was just thinking.

158
00:16:02,129 --> 00:16:03,755
What you do...

159
00:16:04,923 --> 00:16:09,970
It seems kind of dangerous...
right now.

160
00:16:10,012 --> 00:16:11,972
How do you know
I'm not the killer?

161
00:16:11,972 --> 00:16:15,267
You don't seem like
the killer type. Why?

162
00:16:16,185 --> 00:16:18,437
You feeling any urges
I should know about?

163
00:16:30,490 --> 00:16:31,658
Shoot.

164
00:17:19,331 --> 00:17:23,168
So it seems you've discovered
your unpleasant nature.

165
00:17:23,210 --> 00:17:27,005
-Who are you?
-We might ask the same question.

166
00:17:28,006 --> 00:17:30,259
Sleep...now.

167
00:17:55,784 --> 00:17:56,994
He can Tune!

168
00:18:50,172 --> 00:18:53,300
What is to be done?
This man is dangerous.

169
00:18:53,425 --> 00:18:56,512
-It is said he is able to Tune.
-Impossible!

170
00:18:56,595 --> 00:18:59,640
We have seen it
with our own eyes.

171
00:18:59,640 --> 00:19:02,518
On occasion, the imprinting
does not take.

172
00:19:02,518 --> 00:19:05,062
They behave erratically
when they awaken.

173
00:19:05,145 --> 00:19:08,774
We find them wandering
like lost children.

174
00:19:08,815 --> 00:19:10,943
But this one was different, yes?

175
00:19:10,984 --> 00:19:14,738
-What has the doctor to say?
-He has failed to report in.

176
00:19:14,780 --> 00:19:17,908
-And Mr. Quick?
-No more Mr. Quick.

177
00:19:17,950 --> 00:19:20,577
Mr. Quick...dead, yes.

178
00:19:23,956 --> 00:19:26,583
Poor, poor Mr. Quick.

179
00:19:26,583 --> 00:19:29,545
Mr. Book...does he know?

180
00:19:30,546 --> 00:19:32,631
Should we not know, Mr. Hand?

181
00:19:33,632 --> 00:19:36,510
We had hoped to learn more
before sharing with you.

182
00:19:36,552 --> 00:19:39,513
We can know nothing
until we possess him.

183
00:19:39,513 --> 00:19:41,807
We must have this man.

184
00:19:47,688 --> 00:19:48,856
My brand, I hope.

185
00:20:01,201 --> 00:20:02,786
I've been worried about you.

186
00:20:06,832 --> 00:20:08,166
Are you punishing me?

187
00:20:08,917 --> 00:20:11,545
If disappearing is
your way of punishing me,

188
00:20:11,587 --> 00:20:12,796
I don't appreciate it.

189
00:20:12,838 --> 00:20:14,006
What are you talking about?

190
00:20:17,509 --> 00:20:21,305
I found these keys in my pocket,
so I assume I live here.

191
00:20:23,515 --> 00:20:25,851
-You supposed to be my wife?
-"Supposed to be"?

192
00:20:29,354 --> 00:20:33,358
You really...don't know
who I am, do you.

193
00:20:34,234 --> 00:20:37,029
Your doctor called me. He was
worried that this might happen.

194
00:20:37,029 --> 00:20:38,363
My doctor?

195
00:20:41,283 --> 00:20:44,995
He gave me his card.
He's desperate to find you.

196
00:20:52,753 --> 00:20:54,755
Feel like I'm living out
someone else's nightmare.

197
00:20:54,796 --> 00:20:57,591
What happened to me?
Why was I seeing a doctor?

198
00:20:58,217 --> 00:20:59,718
I had an affair.

199
00:21:01,595 --> 00:21:02,930
You were angry at me.

200
00:21:06,099 --> 00:21:09,770
Closing time.
The pool is now closed.

201
00:21:19,488 --> 00:21:21,823
Most unfortunate it is...

202
00:21:21,823 --> 00:21:24,159
that we were forced
to seek you out here.

203
00:21:25,118 --> 00:21:29,289
You know how uncomfortable
we find all this moisture.

204
00:21:30,165 --> 00:21:33,460
-I'm sorry. I--
-Failed to report in, yes?

205
00:21:33,502 --> 00:21:36,463
I was frightened.
I have a weak heart, you know.

206
00:21:36,463 --> 00:21:40,008
Your weakness is not, we think,
an affair of the heart.

207
00:21:40,092 --> 00:21:42,761
We found this in his hotel room.

208
00:21:42,761 --> 00:21:46,265
Must we reproduce
Mr. Murdoch's memories again?

209
00:21:46,306 --> 00:21:48,475
I tried to reprint him,
but he woke up.

210
00:21:48,517 --> 00:21:50,686
He knocked the syringe
right out of my hand.

211
00:21:50,769 --> 00:21:53,939
-He has no memories, then?
-Only fragments.

212
00:21:53,939 --> 00:21:55,482
The procedure,
it was interrupted.

213
00:21:55,482 --> 00:21:58,235
I guess it's only a matter
of rounding him up.

214
00:21:58,986 --> 00:22:00,696
You have had strays
before, right?

215
00:22:00,737 --> 00:22:04,616
This is no stray, Doctor.
This one can Tune.

216
00:22:04,616 --> 00:22:07,703
But that's impossible.
Only you have that ability.

217
00:22:07,744 --> 00:22:10,038
You will process
another template...

218
00:22:10,080 --> 00:22:12,124
of the subject's memories, yes?

219
00:22:12,165 --> 00:22:13,750
Of course.
I'll imprint him again.

220
00:22:15,335 --> 00:22:18,630
We require them
for a quite different purpose.

221
00:22:18,630 --> 00:22:21,466
It's almost midnight,
Dr. Schreber.

222
00:22:21,508 --> 00:22:23,302
We'll talk again
after tonight's Tuning,

223
00:22:23,343 --> 00:22:26,305
but no more delays, yes?

224
00:22:26,305 --> 00:22:31,143
No more inconsistencies
in your behavior.

225
00:22:33,020 --> 00:22:34,646
The police were looking for you.

226
00:22:34,646 --> 00:22:36,815
I know. I saw the papers.

227
00:22:36,857 --> 00:22:39,359
"Killer stalks
city street-walkers."

228
00:22:42,988 --> 00:22:45,282
I was with one of those women.

229
00:22:46,825 --> 00:22:50,245
-Before I came here tonight.
-I don't understand.

230
00:22:50,287 --> 00:22:55,209
I met her outside an Automat.
I guess I wanted to test myself.

231
00:22:56,919 --> 00:23:00,339
I wanted to know if I had it
in me to do those things.

232
00:23:00,339 --> 00:23:01,840
Maybe I have lost my mind,

233
00:23:01,882 --> 00:23:04,885
but whoever I am, I'm still me,
and I'm not a killer.

234
00:23:10,891 --> 00:23:12,267
I believe you.

235
00:23:14,102 --> 00:23:15,354
You do?

236
00:23:19,858 --> 00:23:21,860
-What?
-The car outside.

237
00:23:21,902 --> 00:23:23,362
The one you arrived in.

238
00:23:23,403 --> 00:23:25,697
It's a cop.
He dropped me off here.

239
00:23:27,866 --> 00:23:29,618
I didn't know he was still here.

240
00:23:33,205 --> 00:23:34,665
Hold it right there, mister!

241
00:23:37,084 --> 00:23:40,087
-Wait. You have the wrong man.
-Stand aside, will you, please?

242
00:23:40,128 --> 00:23:41,588
I didn't kill anyone.

243
00:23:41,630 --> 00:23:43,924
Right now,
all you are is a suspect.

244
00:23:43,966 --> 00:23:47,219
Turn yourself in. I'll listen
to whatever you have to say.

245
00:23:47,261 --> 00:23:49,304
You won't believe
what I have to say.

246
00:23:50,430 --> 00:23:53,767
-Try me.
-There's someone after me.

247
00:23:53,767 --> 00:23:57,437
It's this group of men.
They want me dead.

248
00:23:57,437 --> 00:24:00,274
And I don't even know if...
they're not even--

249
00:24:00,274 --> 00:24:02,526
Yeah, who's going to listen
to a madman?

250
00:24:02,568 --> 00:24:05,070
-Stand aside, Mrs. Murdoch.
-Run!

251
00:24:09,408 --> 00:24:11,368
No one ever listens to me.

252
00:24:17,666 --> 00:24:18,750
Murdoch, stop!

253
00:25:01,627 --> 00:25:03,962
-How much further?
-We're almost there, buddy.

254
00:25:07,508 --> 00:25:09,843
You happen to know
the way to Shell Beach?

255
00:25:09,885 --> 00:25:12,971
You're kidding! Me and the wife
spent our honeymoon there.

256
00:25:13,013 --> 00:25:15,516
All you do is
take Main Street West to...

257
00:25:18,519 --> 00:25:21,688
Or is it the Cross...
Now, that's funny.

258
00:25:21,772 --> 00:25:24,858
I can't seem to remember
if it's Main Street West...

259
00:25:24,942 --> 00:25:26,235
or the Crosstown.

260
00:25:30,906 --> 00:25:33,951
I'm sorry, lnspector,
I cannot be of more assistance,

261
00:25:34,034 --> 00:25:35,994
but I am running late
for an appointment.

262
00:25:36,036 --> 00:25:38,163
Well, I appreciate you
taking the time.

263
00:25:46,880 --> 00:25:49,341
There's just one thing
that puzzles me.

264
00:25:49,341 --> 00:25:53,887
I've met quite a few murderers
in the course of my work.

265
00:25:53,929 --> 00:25:56,682
Murdoch doesn't
strike me as one.

266
00:25:56,723 --> 00:25:59,893
Perhaps you are not accustomed
to digging deep enough.

267
00:25:59,893 --> 00:26:02,729
Well, I do know when
someone is lying to me, Doctor.

268
00:26:02,813 --> 00:26:07,025
Inspector, judging personalities
happens to be my business.

269
00:26:07,025 --> 00:26:09,027
Maybe you can give me
a few pointers.

270
00:26:09,069 --> 00:26:13,031
Certainly.
Let's take you, for instance.

271
00:26:13,073 --> 00:26:16,159
You are a fastidious man.
Driven.

272
00:26:16,243 --> 00:26:18,495
Consumed by details.

273
00:26:18,537 --> 00:26:22,040
I would say
your life is rather lonely.

274
00:26:22,082 --> 00:26:24,710
Good evening, lnspector.
I really must be going.

275
00:27:02,456 --> 00:27:03,540
Come in.

276
00:27:08,545 --> 00:27:10,339
-How is he?
-The same.

277
00:27:11,632 --> 00:27:14,259
Walenski? It's me, Frank.

278
00:27:20,641 --> 00:27:21,850
Come in, Frank.

279
00:27:25,145 --> 00:27:26,271
Close the door.

280
00:27:34,363 --> 00:27:37,658
I've been looking through
some of your old reports.

281
00:27:37,699 --> 00:27:39,785
It's an interesting case.

282
00:27:40,911 --> 00:27:44,122
Kind that make a man's career.

283
00:27:45,832 --> 00:27:49,461
-Or break it.
-Yeah. I was on that case.

284
00:27:49,503 --> 00:27:53,340
And then what?
What happened then, Eddie?

285
00:27:53,382 --> 00:27:54,800
Nothing happened, Frank.

286
00:27:55,843 --> 00:27:57,845
I've just been spending time
in the subway,

287
00:27:57,886 --> 00:27:59,805
riding in circles.

288
00:27:59,847 --> 00:28:03,392
Thinking in circles.
There's no way out.

289
00:28:05,686 --> 00:28:07,354
I've been over this entire city.

290
00:28:11,817 --> 00:28:13,694
You're scaring your wife
to death, Eddie.

291
00:28:13,735 --> 00:28:15,237
She's not my wife.

292
00:28:17,072 --> 00:28:20,033
I don't know who she is
or who any of us are.

293
00:28:20,075 --> 00:28:23,453
-What makes you say that?
-You think about the past much?

294
00:28:25,497 --> 00:28:26,999
As much as the next guy.

295
00:28:28,000 --> 00:28:30,752
See, I've been trying
to remember things--

296
00:28:30,794 --> 00:28:33,881
clearly remember things
from my past.

297
00:28:33,922 --> 00:28:36,091
But the more
I try to think back,

298
00:28:36,175 --> 00:28:39,178
the more it all starts
to unravel.

299
00:28:39,219 --> 00:28:40,387
None of it seems real.

300
00:28:40,387 --> 00:28:44,558
It's like I've just
been dreaming this life,

301
00:28:44,558 --> 00:28:47,561
and when I finally wake up,
I'll be somebody else,

302
00:28:47,561 --> 00:28:49,521
somebody totally different.

303
00:28:53,942 --> 00:28:56,069
You saw something,
didn't you, Eddie.

304
00:28:57,237 --> 00:28:59,740
Something to do with the case.

305
00:29:00,365 --> 00:29:03,744
There is no case!
There never was!

306
00:29:03,785 --> 00:29:07,706
It's all just a big joke!
It's a joke!

307
00:29:48,747 --> 00:29:50,499
Tonight's requirements are...

308
00:29:50,541 --> 00:29:53,794
12 family photo albums,

309
00:29:53,836 --> 00:29:56,255
nine personal diaries,

310
00:29:56,296 --> 00:29:58,423
17 love letters,

311
00:29:58,465 --> 00:30:00,926
assorted childhood photographs,

312
00:30:00,968 --> 00:30:05,138
requisite false l.D.s
and social security cards.

313
00:30:05,138 --> 00:30:07,474
These do bring back memories.

314
00:30:09,810 --> 00:30:12,104
This one is still warm.

315
00:30:12,813 --> 00:30:13,981
What is it?

316
00:30:13,981 --> 00:30:17,234
The recollections of
a great lover?

317
00:30:17,276 --> 00:30:19,570
A catalogue of conquests?

318
00:30:20,279 --> 00:30:21,780
We will soon find out.

319
00:30:23,073 --> 00:30:24,575
You wouldn't
appreciate that,

320
00:30:24,616 --> 00:30:27,828
would you,
Mr. Whatever-your-name is?

321
00:30:27,870 --> 00:30:32,165
Not the sort of conquest
you would ever understand.

322
00:30:32,958 --> 00:30:34,251
Let's see.

323
00:30:35,544 --> 00:30:38,255
A touch of
unhappy childhood...

324
00:30:43,969 --> 00:30:46,513
A dash of
teenage rebellion...

325
00:30:48,140 --> 00:30:51,226
And last but not least...

326
00:30:51,226 --> 00:30:53,854
a tragic death
in the family.

327
00:30:56,648 --> 00:30:58,317
Mr. Book.

328
00:31:05,324 --> 00:31:08,911
Why does Murdoch not sleep
during the Tuning?

329
00:31:08,952 --> 00:31:13,207
Maybe he's a step up
the evolutionary ladder.

330
00:31:13,248 --> 00:31:14,499
A freak of nature.

331
00:31:14,499 --> 00:31:17,336
He's adapting to survive.
What do you expect?

332
00:31:17,377 --> 00:31:19,296
Weren't you looking for
the human soul?

333
00:31:19,338 --> 00:31:22,007
Isn't that the purpose
of your little zoo?

334
00:31:22,007 --> 00:31:25,344
That's why you change people
and things every night.

335
00:31:25,385 --> 00:31:28,263
Maybe you have finally
found what you are looking for,

336
00:31:28,347 --> 00:31:29,890
and it's going to bite you
on your--

337
00:31:33,936 --> 00:31:35,812
It requires several
of your lifetimes...

338
00:31:35,854 --> 00:31:37,523
to master our gifts.

339
00:31:37,564 --> 00:31:39,358
The idea that
a simple man...

340
00:31:39,399 --> 00:31:41,401
could develop the ability
to Tune is--

341
00:31:41,443 --> 00:31:42,569
Absurd, I know.

342
00:31:42,569 --> 00:31:44,905
What other explanation is there?

343
00:31:49,868 --> 00:31:51,036
It is time.

344
00:32:36,957 --> 00:32:38,417
Shut it down.

345
00:32:56,977 --> 00:33:00,063
Fredrickson says he'll take me
off the night shift.

346
00:33:00,105 --> 00:33:01,940
It's about time, dear.

347
00:33:52,699 --> 00:33:53,700
Hello?

348
00:34:02,000 --> 00:34:03,335
Wake up.

349
00:34:06,505 --> 00:34:08,006
Wake up!

350
00:34:18,058 --> 00:34:20,185
Can anyone hear me?

351
00:34:23,355 --> 00:34:26,191
Let the Tuning commence.

352
00:37:06,059 --> 00:37:07,436
The Goodwins.

353
00:37:07,436 --> 00:37:09,396
Charlie, Sylvia,

354
00:37:09,479 --> 00:37:11,565
Jane, and little Matthew.

355
00:37:15,444 --> 00:37:17,654
Jane and little Matthew.

356
00:37:47,809 --> 00:37:50,103
The rich get richer.

357
00:37:50,145 --> 00:37:52,147
Probably have
maid's quarters...

358
00:37:52,231 --> 00:37:53,607
before the night
is through.

359
00:38:47,160 --> 00:38:49,121
Dr. Schreber, I presume.

360
00:38:49,162 --> 00:38:50,664
It's you.

361
00:38:50,664 --> 00:38:51,707
Hey, come on.

362
00:38:51,790 --> 00:38:53,959
That's no way to greet
a patient, Doctor,

363
00:38:53,959 --> 00:38:56,086
if that's what you are.

364
00:38:56,128 --> 00:38:57,629
Please, l--

365
00:38:57,629 --> 00:38:59,464
Why is everyone asleep?

366
00:38:59,506 --> 00:39:01,884
Please keep your voice down.

367
00:39:01,967 --> 00:39:03,844
I can't remember anything.
What have you done?

368
00:39:03,886 --> 00:39:06,680
Nothing. I want to help you.

369
00:39:06,722 --> 00:39:10,142
We cannot talk here.
If they see us together--

370
00:39:10,184 --> 00:39:13,061
I don't care.
I want some answers. Now!

371
00:39:13,145 --> 00:39:16,190
Who are they?
Why are they trying to kill me?

372
00:39:16,273 --> 00:39:17,357
Answer me!

373
00:39:22,487 --> 00:39:23,530
My God.

374
00:39:23,572 --> 00:39:26,617
-You really can do it.
-I did that?

375
00:39:26,658 --> 00:39:29,286
Listen to me.
You have their power.

376
00:39:29,328 --> 00:39:31,288
You can make things happen
by will alone.

377
00:39:31,330 --> 00:39:32,915
They call it "Tuning."

378
00:39:32,956 --> 00:39:34,917
That is how they change
the buildings.

379
00:39:35,000 --> 00:39:37,503
Just now you acted
out of self-defense,

380
00:39:37,544 --> 00:39:40,339
but I can teach you
to control your power.

381
00:39:40,339 --> 00:39:44,343
We can stop them.
We can take the city back.

382
00:39:47,679 --> 00:39:49,181
My glasses.

383
00:40:43,360 --> 00:40:45,696
He made a terrible impression
for the firm,

384
00:40:45,737 --> 00:40:48,574
Iollygagging around
as he did.

385
00:40:48,615 --> 00:40:51,493
So I told Fredrickson
I was letting him go.

386
00:40:51,535 --> 00:40:53,537
Well you should have, darling.

387
00:40:54,246 --> 00:40:57,332
He attacked me.
I don't know where he's gone.

388
00:40:57,833 --> 00:41:01,795
Come, Dr. Schreber.
We have much to do.

389
00:41:01,837 --> 00:41:04,423
-Yes?
-Yes.

390
00:41:06,842 --> 00:41:13,307
They say that
you're a runaround lover

391
00:41:14,349 --> 00:41:22,399
Though you say it isn't so

392
00:41:25,277 --> 00:41:32,117
But if you put me down
for another

393
00:41:33,702 --> 00:41:39,625
I'll know, believe me, I'll know

394
00:41:41,084 --> 00:41:44,630
Tonight's experiment will
take place in these locations.

395
00:41:44,630 --> 00:41:48,675
The first subject
shall be imprinted on Avenue M.

396
00:41:48,717 --> 00:41:51,720
Mr. Book, there is a problem.

397
00:41:51,803 --> 00:41:53,347
There is no Avenue M.

398
00:41:53,388 --> 00:41:55,307
We were unable
to complete it.

399
00:41:55,349 --> 00:41:58,810
During the last Tuning,
we detected a lack of control.

400
00:41:58,852 --> 00:42:02,022
An opposing influence
on the machines?

401
00:42:02,105 --> 00:42:06,318
This man Murdoch is
more powerful than we thought.

402
00:42:06,360 --> 00:42:08,320
He is becoming like us.

403
00:42:08,320 --> 00:42:11,782
So we must become like him.

404
00:42:12,699 --> 00:42:15,035
The doctor has done as we asked?

405
00:42:15,077 --> 00:42:18,789
The life and times
of John Murdoch, volume two.

406
00:42:20,791 --> 00:42:23,377
We must not do this.

407
00:42:23,418 --> 00:42:26,839
Murdoch does not possess
these memories, yes?

408
00:42:26,839 --> 00:42:29,675
How will his imprint
allow us to find him?

409
00:42:29,716 --> 00:42:33,178
Everywhere he goes,
everyone he seeks out...

410
00:42:33,220 --> 00:42:34,429
will be known to us.

411
00:42:34,513 --> 00:42:39,601
And as he follows the clues,
so shall we follow the memories.

412
00:42:39,685 --> 00:42:42,062
But to imprint one of us?

413
00:42:42,104 --> 00:42:44,815
Failure has always resulted.

414
00:42:44,857 --> 00:42:48,402
What Mr. Hand proposes
is our only option.

415
00:42:48,443 --> 00:42:50,070
Imprint.

416
00:42:55,492 --> 00:42:57,411
This may sting a bit.

417
00:43:33,906 --> 00:43:35,616
Is it done?

418
00:43:35,657 --> 00:43:38,076
Oh, yes, Mr. Book.

419
00:43:38,118 --> 00:43:41,955
I have John Murdoch in mind.

420
00:43:42,623 --> 00:43:44,249
"Johnny...

421
00:43:44,249 --> 00:43:48,253
"Found this postcard
among your mother's things.

422
00:43:48,295 --> 00:43:50,589
"Brings back memories,
doesn't it?

423
00:43:50,589 --> 00:43:52,424
"Stop by sometime.

424
00:43:52,466 --> 00:43:55,761
"We'll see if we can't
hook ourselves another mermaid.

425
00:43:55,802 --> 00:43:58,138
"Love to Emma. Karl."

426
00:44:03,644 --> 00:44:04,603
Karl.

427
00:44:06,438 --> 00:44:08,106
Karl Harris.

428
00:44:16,281 --> 00:44:17,324
Harris.

429
00:44:25,624 --> 00:44:28,669
Excuse me.
Which way is Avenue C?

430
00:44:28,710 --> 00:44:29,962
Try the subway.

431
00:44:33,674 --> 00:44:35,175
You got a problem, pal?

432
00:44:35,217 --> 00:44:38,053
Been working here long?

433
00:44:38,136 --> 00:44:41,473
25 years.
No days off for good behavior.

434
00:45:06,582 --> 00:45:09,501
We're looking for John Murdoch.

435
00:45:43,744 --> 00:45:45,829
She knows nothing,
Mr. Hand.

436
00:45:45,871 --> 00:45:47,706
A dead end, Mr. Wall.

437
00:45:47,748 --> 00:45:50,501
We thought his imprint
would let us track him.

438
00:45:50,542 --> 00:45:53,045
But instead
we have been brought here.

439
00:45:53,086 --> 00:45:57,132
-This is irrational.
-Instincts are irrational.

440
00:45:57,216 --> 00:46:00,469
We must follow
where they lead, yes?

441
00:46:00,552 --> 00:46:03,764
Mr. Sleep suggests he may go
to places familiar.

442
00:46:03,805 --> 00:46:05,140
His job.

443
00:46:05,224 --> 00:46:07,267
He does not care about our job.

444
00:46:07,267 --> 00:46:10,103
Indulge us, Mr. Hand.

445
00:46:10,145 --> 00:46:12,731
If you were Murdoch, yes?

446
00:46:12,773 --> 00:46:16,109
If I were Murdoch...

447
00:46:17,945 --> 00:46:21,448
I would remember how
my wife had hurt me...

448
00:46:21,490 --> 00:46:23,534
by sleeping with another man.

449
00:46:25,077 --> 00:46:26,578
And then...

450
00:46:28,497 --> 00:46:31,917
I would look for a way
to hurt her in return.

451
00:46:34,920 --> 00:46:39,508
Leave me alone with her.
There's work to be done.

452
00:46:43,178 --> 00:46:45,264
All change,
platform three.

453
00:46:48,016 --> 00:46:49,101
All change?

454
00:46:49,142 --> 00:46:51,478
Excuse me, how do I get
to the end of the line?

455
00:46:51,478 --> 00:46:52,938
You want the Express.

456
00:47:05,534 --> 00:47:07,995
How come the train didn't stop?

457
00:47:08,036 --> 00:47:09,329
That's the Express.

458
00:47:10,873 --> 00:47:12,791
There's no way out.

459
00:47:12,833 --> 00:47:15,627
You can't get out of the city.
I've tried.

460
00:47:16,753 --> 00:47:18,839
You're Murdoch, aren't you?

461
00:47:18,881 --> 00:47:20,549
The one
they've been looking for.

462
00:47:20,632 --> 00:47:21,717
You're not a killer.

463
00:47:21,800 --> 00:47:24,511
They set you up with
a fake identity,

464
00:47:24,511 --> 00:47:26,180
Iike everyone else here.

465
00:47:26,180 --> 00:47:28,140
-Who are you?
-I was a cop.

466
00:47:28,182 --> 00:47:31,310
At least in this life I was.

467
00:47:31,351 --> 00:47:34,188
They steal peoples' memories.

468
00:47:34,188 --> 00:47:35,981
Then they swap them around
between us.

469
00:47:35,981 --> 00:47:38,734
I seen them do it,
back and forth...

470
00:47:38,775 --> 00:47:40,903
till no one knows
who they are anymore.

471
00:47:40,944 --> 00:47:42,237
How do you know all this?

472
00:47:42,279 --> 00:47:44,072
Once in a while one of us
wakes up...

473
00:47:44,114 --> 00:47:45,532
while they're changing things.

474
00:47:46,450 --> 00:47:48,952
It's not supposed to happen,
but it does.

475
00:47:48,994 --> 00:47:50,329
It happened to me.

476
00:47:50,996 --> 00:47:52,915
They'll come looking for you.

477
00:47:54,041 --> 00:47:56,376
Just like they'll come
looking for me.

478
00:47:56,418 --> 00:47:57,836
But that's OK.

479
00:47:57,836 --> 00:47:59,087
I figured a way out.

480
00:48:10,557 --> 00:48:11,767
They were here.

481
00:48:13,894 --> 00:48:15,270
Last night.

482
00:48:15,354 --> 00:48:17,523
This was to be his home.

483
00:48:20,192 --> 00:48:21,985
That was when we loved her.

484
00:48:22,027 --> 00:48:24,363
This is all well and good,

485
00:48:24,404 --> 00:48:26,406
but we require
a more practical link...

486
00:48:26,448 --> 00:48:28,492
to his present whereabouts.

487
00:48:33,121 --> 00:48:35,165
And I know where to find her.

488
00:48:43,590 --> 00:48:46,927
We're very lucky,
when you think about it.

489
00:48:46,927 --> 00:48:47,970
I'm sorry?

490
00:48:48,053 --> 00:48:50,097
To be able to revisit
those places...

491
00:48:50,097 --> 00:48:52,099
which meant
so very much to us.

492
00:48:52,933 --> 00:48:55,477
I thought we were haunted
by them.

493
00:48:55,561 --> 00:48:57,271
Perhaps.

494
00:48:57,271 --> 00:48:59,731
There used to be a ferry
when I was a boy.

495
00:48:59,731 --> 00:49:01,859
Biggest thing you ever saw.

496
00:49:01,900 --> 00:49:04,736
Lit up like
a floating birthday cake.

497
00:49:06,113 --> 00:49:08,699
That's just what my husband
once said to me.

498
00:49:08,740 --> 00:49:10,284
On this very spot.

499
00:49:11,785 --> 00:49:13,871
Where is your husband now?

500
00:49:13,912 --> 00:49:17,749
I wish I knew.
What brings you here?

501
00:49:17,749 --> 00:49:20,627
I met my wife at this place.

502
00:49:20,669 --> 00:49:22,921
It's where I met my husband.

503
00:49:22,963 --> 00:49:24,464
Small world.

504
00:50:18,644 --> 00:50:19,645
Hello?

505
00:51:06,942 --> 00:51:08,819
What are you doing here?

506
00:51:08,861 --> 00:51:10,487
I've been following you.

507
00:51:14,408 --> 00:51:16,118
Hold it right there!

508
00:51:18,203 --> 00:51:19,162
Johnny?

509
00:51:22,291 --> 00:51:23,584
It's been so damn long,

510
00:51:23,625 --> 00:51:25,752
I thought you'd forgotten
your Uncle Karl.

511
00:51:26,962 --> 00:51:28,380
You son of a gun!

512
00:51:31,800 --> 00:51:33,051
Uncle Karl...

513
00:51:36,096 --> 00:51:37,097
Wait.

514
00:51:39,975 --> 00:51:42,102
-Is that me?
-Yeah.

515
00:51:50,402 --> 00:51:52,154
Shell Beach is where
I grew up?

516
00:51:52,196 --> 00:51:54,823
That's what I said.
Shell Beach.

517
00:51:54,865 --> 00:51:57,284
-Your home town.
-I need to get there.

518
00:51:57,326 --> 00:51:58,368
How do I get there?

519
00:51:59,786 --> 00:52:02,706
I don't know.
I haven't been there in years.

520
00:52:02,748 --> 00:52:05,626
You must remember.
You must have some idea.

521
00:52:07,586 --> 00:52:08,837
Sorry, Johnny.

522
00:52:10,255 --> 00:52:12,799
The old cracker barrel
ain't what it used to be.

523
00:52:16,637 --> 00:52:20,098
-It was so bright there.
-Brighter times, I guess.

524
00:52:21,808 --> 00:52:25,145
You were always scribbling
in that damn book.

525
00:52:25,187 --> 00:52:27,105
That's me and your Pa.

526
00:52:27,147 --> 00:52:29,483
What a couple of
handsome fools.

527
00:52:29,483 --> 00:52:31,068
What happened to my parents?

528
00:52:33,612 --> 00:52:34,738
Where are they now?

529
00:52:35,989 --> 00:52:37,783
They're dead, Johnny.

530
00:52:37,824 --> 00:52:40,577
They died when the house
burned down.

531
00:52:40,619 --> 00:52:42,246
I looked after you.

532
00:52:43,163 --> 00:52:44,915
You don't remember that,
really?

533
00:52:47,751 --> 00:52:50,254
What's that? What is that?

534
00:52:56,134 --> 00:52:58,011
It's a scar.

535
00:52:58,011 --> 00:53:00,347
You burned your arm pretty bad
in the fire.

536
00:53:05,894 --> 00:53:07,479
What does it mean?

537
00:53:07,521 --> 00:53:09,481
It means these are all lies!

538
00:53:13,527 --> 00:53:15,904
My husband told me
he'd been here.

539
00:53:15,946 --> 00:53:18,740
He told me he wanted
to test himself.

540
00:53:18,782 --> 00:53:21,076
See if he was...

541
00:53:21,118 --> 00:53:23,453
capable of...

542
00:53:32,337 --> 00:53:34,173
I wanted to talk to her.

543
00:53:34,214 --> 00:53:36,175
I thought she could
help me find him.

544
00:53:37,885 --> 00:53:39,887
I'm going to call the station.

545
00:53:56,028 --> 00:53:57,237
It's beautiful.

546
00:53:59,948 --> 00:54:02,784
It was a gift from my mother.

547
00:54:02,826 --> 00:54:04,369
She died recently.

548
00:54:05,746 --> 00:54:08,040
I keep it with me
to remind me of her.

549
00:54:10,209 --> 00:54:11,210
I'm sorry.

550
00:54:14,880 --> 00:54:17,049
It's a funny thing, though.

551
00:54:17,049 --> 00:54:19,551
I can't remember
when she gave it to me.

552
00:54:21,970 --> 00:54:24,431
How do you think I could
forget a thing like that?

553
00:54:25,933 --> 00:54:28,393
What's happening, lnspector?

554
00:54:28,435 --> 00:54:30,229
I'm not sure I know anymore.

555
00:54:34,191 --> 00:54:35,943
I left your old room
like it was.

556
00:54:36,985 --> 00:54:39,238
You can sleep here tonight.

557
00:54:39,279 --> 00:54:41,406
Glad to have you back, Johnny.

558
00:54:41,406 --> 00:54:44,201
-Even if it is for just a night.
-Karl.

559
00:54:45,327 --> 00:54:47,996
-Is that the right time?
-Why, sure.

560
00:54:48,038 --> 00:54:50,457
That clock's kept perfect time
since I bought it.

561
00:54:50,499 --> 00:54:51,834
A.M. or P.M.?

562
00:54:53,502 --> 00:54:55,921
-What do you think?
-I don't understand.

563
00:54:55,921 --> 00:54:58,757
How can it be night already?
What happened to the day?

564
00:54:58,757 --> 00:55:01,260
You're tired.
Anything's possible.

565
00:55:02,970 --> 00:55:03,971
Get some sleep.

566
00:55:03,971 --> 00:55:06,473
We'll straighten all this out
tomorrow.

567
00:55:38,547 --> 00:55:39,798
Come on...

568
00:56:00,194 --> 00:56:03,197
He's here.
He's acting peculiar.

569
00:56:03,238 --> 00:56:05,616
I know. He's not himself.

570
00:56:05,657 --> 00:56:07,701
Keep him there,
and I'll be right over.

571
00:56:07,743 --> 00:56:09,995
-I'll try.
-Thanks. Bye.

572
00:56:13,540 --> 00:56:16,919
I can't promise anything.
We'll play it as it comes.

573
00:56:17,669 --> 00:56:20,506
We just wanted to help.

574
00:56:27,221 --> 00:56:30,891
Karl. Uncle Karl.

575
00:56:30,891 --> 00:56:34,394
If you're in trouble,
maybe we can do something.

576
00:56:35,812 --> 00:56:38,315
Haven't seen you in so long.

577
00:57:52,931 --> 00:57:57,603
Mr. Murdoch, you've been
the cause of much distress.

578
00:58:02,399 --> 00:58:04,776
-Start talking.
-There's no need for this.

579
00:58:04,818 --> 00:58:08,405
There's no escape.
The city's ours. We made it.

580
00:58:08,447 --> 00:58:09,781
What are you talking about?

581
00:58:09,823 --> 00:58:12,910
We fashioned this city
on stolen memories.

582
00:58:12,951 --> 00:58:16,705
Different eras, different pasts,
all rolled into one.

583
00:58:16,747 --> 00:58:20,792
Each night we revise it,
refine it, in order to learn.

584
00:58:20,834 --> 00:58:23,879
-Learn what?
-About you.

585
00:58:23,962 --> 00:58:28,300
You and your fellow inhabitants.
What makes you human.

586
00:58:28,342 --> 00:58:31,845
-Why?
-We need to be like you.

587
00:58:32,679 --> 00:58:34,848
I understand you now.

588
00:58:34,848 --> 00:58:38,477
I remember that which you do
not, what you've been missing.

589
00:58:38,519 --> 00:58:43,982
The ocean, yes? Running along
the waves as a child.

590
00:58:44,024 --> 00:58:48,529
Meeting Emma at the river,
that first kiss that followed.

591
00:58:49,530 --> 00:58:52,658
-What are you?
-You've seen what we are.

592
00:58:52,699 --> 00:58:55,285
We use your dead as vessels.

593
01:01:04,957 --> 01:01:05,958
Get in!

594
01:01:21,473 --> 01:01:25,352
-What about her? Ring a bell?
-She was alive when I left her.

595
01:01:25,394 --> 01:01:28,438
-What about this?
-This is nothing.

596
01:01:28,480 --> 01:01:30,691
It must mean something--
all those pictures.

597
01:01:30,732 --> 01:01:31,733
What pictures?

598
01:01:33,193 --> 01:01:36,029
-I don't understand this.
-Stop playing games with me.

599
01:01:36,113 --> 01:01:38,574
-Stop telling me lies.
-I am not telling lies!

600
01:01:38,615 --> 01:01:40,951
Help me out.
Make me understand.

601
01:01:40,993 --> 01:01:45,956
I have this jigsaw puzzle in
my face, and it makes no sense.

602
01:01:45,998 --> 01:01:49,334
You think it makes sense to me?
I'm as confused as you are.

603
01:01:49,376 --> 01:01:53,338
Let me ask you a question.
Have you heard of Shell Beach?

604
01:01:53,338 --> 01:01:55,507
-Sure.
-You know how to get there?

605
01:01:55,507 --> 01:01:57,217
-Yeah.
-Tell me.

606
01:01:57,759 --> 01:02:03,015
-Right. You just go to the...
-Where? Where do you go?

607
01:02:03,056 --> 01:02:04,725
Give me a second, will you?

608
01:02:06,685 --> 01:02:08,270
You can't remember, can you?

609
01:02:09,646 --> 01:02:12,149
Thinking that's kind of odd?

610
01:02:13,358 --> 01:02:15,444
Wait. I got a better one.

611
01:02:15,485 --> 01:02:19,239
When was the last time you
did something during the day?

612
01:02:19,865 --> 01:02:22,826
-What do you mean?
-I just mean during the day.

613
01:02:24,036 --> 01:02:26,788
Daylight. When was the last
time you remember seeing it?

614
01:02:26,830 --> 01:02:30,542
I'm not talking about a distant,
half-forgotten childhood memory.

615
01:02:30,584 --> 01:02:33,378
I mean, like, yesterday.
Last week? When?

616
01:02:34,296 --> 01:02:36,048
Do you have a single memory?

617
01:02:37,883 --> 01:02:39,551
You don't, do you?

618
01:02:39,593 --> 01:02:45,140
I don't think the sun
even exists in this place.

619
01:02:45,224 --> 01:02:49,394
'Cause I've been up for hours
and hours, and night never ends.

620
01:02:49,978 --> 01:02:52,231
-That's crazy.
-You're damn right it's crazy.

621
01:02:52,231 --> 01:02:55,859
But listen to me, Bumstead.
It's not just me.

622
01:02:55,901 --> 01:02:58,779
It's all of us. They're doing
something to all of us.

623
01:02:58,862 --> 01:03:00,739
Shut up.
I've heard enough.

624
01:03:00,739 --> 01:03:03,492
-Please listen--
-Shut up!

625
01:03:13,919 --> 01:03:16,755
There has to be an explanation.

626
01:03:24,137 --> 01:03:25,097
Explain this.

627
01:03:46,910 --> 01:03:48,412
I'm so sorry.

628
01:03:49,496 --> 01:03:52,457
I never meant to hurt you.
I don't know why I did.

629
01:03:52,457 --> 01:03:54,251
I wish I could take it back.

630
01:03:54,960 --> 01:03:57,254
You didn't do it.

631
01:03:57,296 --> 01:03:59,006
This affair of yours,

632
01:03:59,047 --> 01:04:02,134
whatever you think you've done,
you didn't do it.

633
01:04:02,134 --> 01:04:03,343
I don't believe it happened.

634
01:04:03,385 --> 01:04:07,181
-What do you mean?
-This will sound crazy.

635
01:04:07,222 --> 01:04:10,350
What if we never knew
each other before now?

636
01:04:10,392 --> 01:04:16,607
What if the first time we met
was last night in our apartment?

637
01:04:16,648 --> 01:04:19,359
And everything you remember,

638
01:04:19,443 --> 01:04:22,654
and everything I'm supposed to
remember never really happened.

639
01:04:22,696 --> 01:04:25,157
Someone just wants us
to think it did.

640
01:04:26,116 --> 01:04:27,618
But how can that be true?

641
01:04:28,243 --> 01:04:31,246
I so vividly remember
meeting you.

642
01:04:32,539 --> 01:04:34,917
I remember falling in love
with you.

643
01:04:36,502 --> 01:04:39,505
-I remember losing you.
-Time's up.

644
01:04:41,048 --> 01:04:45,844
No, wait, please.
Just one more minute.

645
01:04:52,392 --> 01:04:53,894
I love you, John.

646
01:04:57,231 --> 01:04:59,399
You can't fake something
like that.

647
01:05:01,068 --> 01:05:02,569
No, you can't.

648
01:05:31,932 --> 01:05:34,476
Inspector? Sir?

649
01:05:35,894 --> 01:05:38,564
Detective Walenski
killed himself last night.

650
01:05:40,899 --> 01:05:42,276
I thought you should know.

651
01:05:44,945 --> 01:05:49,283
The chief wanted to see you.
Sir?

652
01:05:56,206 --> 01:05:58,083
I knew you'd track
the killer down.

653
01:06:13,640 --> 01:06:14,766
Shoelace.

654
01:06:27,905 --> 01:06:31,074
-How can we help you, sir?
-You can sleep.

655
01:06:34,494 --> 01:06:36,205
Sleep. Sleep.

656
01:06:39,958 --> 01:06:41,126
Evening.

657
01:06:54,014 --> 01:06:57,643
I wanted to be the first to
congratulate you about the case.

658
01:07:00,229 --> 01:07:02,981
Take us to Murdoch.

659
01:07:03,023 --> 01:07:04,024
Sleep.

660
01:07:34,555 --> 01:07:36,181
I knew you'd come eventually.

661
01:07:36,223 --> 01:07:38,725
Isn't it time
you gave me some answers?

662
01:07:40,060 --> 01:07:42,729
Yes, of course.
Won't you please sit down?

663
01:07:46,024 --> 01:07:47,901
I come here often.

664
01:07:47,943 --> 01:07:50,487
It's one of the few places
I'm allowed some peace.

665
01:07:50,946 --> 01:07:53,991
You see, they have
an aversion to water.

666
01:07:54,992 --> 01:07:56,994
One could almost call it
a phobia.

667
01:07:57,452 --> 01:08:00,080
Who are they?
What do they want from me?

668
01:08:00,122 --> 01:08:01,123
Right.

669
01:08:01,832 --> 01:08:06,545
For now, let's say you're
the subject of their experiment.

670
01:08:06,587 --> 01:08:08,046
We all are.

671
01:08:09,715 --> 01:08:15,554
I'm sorry, but I have no time
to do this the right way.

672
01:08:15,596 --> 01:08:19,600
Everything you need to know
is in this syringe.

673
01:08:19,641 --> 01:08:23,228
I need you to inject yourself.
It's the only way to understand.

674
01:08:23,270 --> 01:08:26,064
-You're kidding, right?
-We're running out of time!

675
01:08:26,106 --> 01:08:29,735
-You have to do this now.
-Give me the gun.

676
01:08:29,776 --> 01:08:31,904
He's more disturbed
than we thought.

677
01:08:31,945 --> 01:08:34,823
I may not be the judge
of personality you are,

678
01:08:34,865 --> 01:08:37,826
but you're the one
who looks disturbed.

679
01:08:37,910 --> 01:08:40,412
You don't know what
you're doing.

680
01:08:41,622 --> 01:08:45,542
What exactly is in this, Doctor?

681
01:08:47,252 --> 01:08:50,422
All the answers you've been
looking for, I swear to you.

682
01:08:52,341 --> 01:08:58,138
Guess I'll hold on to it for
safekeeping, if you don't mind.

683
01:08:58,138 --> 01:08:59,473
Let's go, Doctor.

684
01:09:01,016 --> 01:09:04,186
Go? Where are we going?

685
01:09:04,645 --> 01:09:06,313
Shell Beach.

686
01:09:07,439 --> 01:09:10,859
That's where you wanted to go,
isn't it, the ocean?

687
01:09:19,743 --> 01:09:23,163
Won't find anything there.
I've been there--

688
01:09:23,205 --> 01:09:25,541
Then you can show us the way.

689
01:09:25,582 --> 01:09:29,253
I won't. I refuse.
You can't make me go there.

690
01:09:29,294 --> 01:09:31,713
Don't you understand?
They'll be waiting for us.

691
01:09:41,014 --> 01:09:45,519
I don't understand.
There used to be a bridge here.

692
01:09:50,858 --> 01:09:53,902
Try that again, and your friends
will find you in the canal.

693
01:09:53,944 --> 01:09:55,779
Don't hurt me.
I'll tell you everything.

694
01:09:55,821 --> 01:09:57,573
It doesn't matter anymore
anyway.

695
01:10:04,454 --> 01:10:05,455
What?

696
01:10:08,834 --> 01:10:10,377
Who are you people?

697
01:10:10,794 --> 01:10:13,589
Must go to the end
of the canal.

698
01:10:14,882 --> 01:10:17,509
We will give you some more
pretty things soon...

699
01:10:18,719 --> 01:10:21,013
-Anna.
-I'm not Anna.

700
01:10:22,723 --> 01:10:24,766
You will be soon, yes.

701
01:10:29,021 --> 01:10:31,815
I have another use
for her first.

702
01:10:41,325 --> 01:10:43,202
I call them Strangers.

703
01:10:43,785 --> 01:10:46,246
They abducted us
and brought us here.

704
01:10:47,414 --> 01:10:51,877
This city, everyone in it...
is their experiment.

705
01:10:51,877 --> 01:10:54,588
They mix and match our memories
as they see fit,

706
01:10:54,630 --> 01:10:57,299
trying to divine
what makes us unique.

707
01:10:57,799 --> 01:11:00,636
One day, a man might be
an inspector.

708
01:11:00,719 --> 01:11:03,472
The next,
someone entirely different.

709
01:11:03,889 --> 01:11:07,267
When they want to study
a murderer, for instance,

710
01:11:07,309 --> 01:11:11,730
they simply imprint one of their
citizens with a new personality.

711
01:11:11,772 --> 01:11:16,068
Arrange a family for him,
friends, an entire history...

712
01:11:16,109 --> 01:11:17,945
even a lost wallet.

713
01:11:18,028 --> 01:11:20,155
Then they observe the results.

714
01:11:21,406 --> 01:11:25,577
Will a man, given the history of
a killer, continue in that vein?

715
01:11:26,078 --> 01:11:29,665
Or are we, in fact, more than
the sum of our memories?

716
01:11:29,706 --> 01:11:34,253
This business of you being
a killer was a sad coincidence.

717
01:11:34,920 --> 01:11:37,506
You have had dozens of lives
before now.

718
01:11:37,589 --> 01:11:38,966
You happened to wake up...

719
01:11:39,007 --> 01:11:41,844
while I was imprinting you
with this one.

720
01:11:41,927 --> 01:11:43,846
Why are they doing all this?

721
01:11:43,971 --> 01:11:48,100
It is our capacity for
individuality, our souls...

722
01:11:48,141 --> 01:11:49,977
that makes us different
from them.

723
01:11:49,977 --> 01:11:52,479
They think they'll find
the human soul...

724
01:11:52,479 --> 01:11:55,148
if they understand
how our memories work.

725
01:11:55,148 --> 01:11:59,653
They have collective memories.
They share one group mind.

726
01:11:59,695 --> 01:12:04,575
They're dying. Their race is
on the brink of extinction.

727
01:12:04,616 --> 01:12:07,619
-They think we can save them.
-Where do I fit in?

728
01:12:07,661 --> 01:12:12,207
You're different. You resisted
my attempt to imprint you.

729
01:12:17,129 --> 01:12:20,632
Somehow, you have developed
their ability to Tune.

730
01:12:20,632 --> 01:12:23,886
That is how they change things,
how they built this city.

731
01:12:23,969 --> 01:12:26,847
They have machines buried
beneath the surface...

732
01:12:26,847 --> 01:12:30,392
that allow them to focus
their telepathic energies.

733
01:12:31,185 --> 01:12:33,812
They control everything here,
even the sun.

734
01:12:33,854 --> 01:12:36,940
That's why it's always dark.
They can't stand the light.

735
01:12:37,024 --> 01:12:38,483
Why do they need you?

736
01:12:38,525 --> 01:12:40,485
When they first brought us here,

737
01:12:40,485 --> 01:12:44,823
they extracted what was in us
and stored the information,

738
01:12:44,823 --> 01:12:46,783
remixed it like paint...

739
01:12:46,825 --> 01:12:49,328
and gave us back
new memories of their choosing.

740
01:12:49,369 --> 01:12:52,998
But they still needed an artist
to help them.

741
01:12:54,750 --> 01:12:59,713
I understood the human mind
better than they ever could,

742
01:12:59,755 --> 01:13:03,342
so they allowed me to keep
my skills as a scientist...

743
01:13:03,383 --> 01:13:04,843
because they needed them.

744
01:13:04,885 --> 01:13:07,346
They made me delete
everything else.

745
01:13:15,896 --> 01:13:20,359
Can you imagine what it's like
to erase your own past?

746
01:13:20,400 --> 01:13:23,654
What about my past?
What about my childhood?

747
01:13:24,530 --> 01:13:26,615
Shell Beach. Uncle Karl.

748
01:13:27,824 --> 01:13:31,912
What about this?
This was blank when I found it.

749
01:13:31,954 --> 01:13:35,832
You still don't understand.
You were never a boy.

750
01:13:35,874 --> 01:13:37,209
Not in this place.

751
01:13:37,209 --> 01:13:40,087
Your history is an illusion,
a fabrication,

752
01:13:40,128 --> 01:13:41,964
as it is with all of us.

753
01:13:42,005 --> 01:13:44,550
You made those drawings happen
with your gift.

754
01:13:44,550 --> 01:13:46,051
You say they brought us here.

755
01:13:48,428 --> 01:13:49,429
From where?

756
01:13:53,308 --> 01:13:56,478
I'm sorry. I don't remember.

757
01:13:57,312 --> 01:14:01,525
None of us remember that...
what we once were...

758
01:14:01,567 --> 01:14:05,112
what we might have been...
somewhere else.

759
01:14:22,921 --> 01:14:26,675
I've taken you this far.
You don't need me anymore.

760
01:14:26,758 --> 01:14:27,676
Let's go.

761
01:15:13,138 --> 01:15:15,349
There is no ocean, John.

762
01:15:16,683 --> 01:15:18,810
There's nothing beyond the city.

763
01:15:20,395 --> 01:15:22,856
The only place home exists...

764
01:15:25,108 --> 01:15:26,693
is in your head.

765
01:15:38,121 --> 01:15:39,122
Stop!

766
01:15:52,219 --> 01:15:53,220
Please!

767
01:16:14,074 --> 01:16:16,201
Now you know the truth.

768
01:17:15,761 --> 01:17:18,472
You'll allow yourself
to surrender...

769
01:17:18,472 --> 01:17:20,807
or it will result in
this one's death.

770
01:17:20,807 --> 01:17:22,017
What do I care?

771
01:17:22,518 --> 01:17:24,603
She's not my real wife.
She's nothing to me.

772
01:17:24,645 --> 01:17:29,274
But you do still care,
don't you, Mr. Murdoch?

773
01:17:29,316 --> 01:17:33,570
I have become the monster
you were intended to be.

774
01:17:35,489 --> 01:17:39,076
Shall I end her life now,
as you would have?

775
01:17:42,621 --> 01:17:47,960
-Don't hurt her, please.
-Then surrender.

776
01:17:50,128 --> 01:17:51,129
Sleep.

777
01:17:53,298 --> 01:17:54,216
Now.

778
01:18:13,527 --> 01:18:14,528
Sleep.

779
01:18:23,579 --> 01:18:24,955
Kill him.

780
01:18:24,997 --> 01:18:25,998
Kill him !

781
01:18:36,550 --> 01:18:40,012
He is powerful, yes, dangerous.

782
01:18:40,053 --> 01:18:43,390
But he can also lead us
to what we seek...

783
01:18:43,432 --> 01:18:46,602
what the doctor calls the soul.

784
01:18:46,685 --> 01:18:50,564
It is time for our experiment
to move into a final phase.

785
01:18:50,647 --> 01:18:53,442
We no longer need
the other subjects.

786
01:18:53,483 --> 01:18:56,820
The time for study is over.

787
01:18:56,820 --> 01:19:01,200
It is time to be one
with John Murdoch.

788
01:19:08,040 --> 01:19:11,376
It is time, Doctor. Imprint.

789
01:19:14,046 --> 01:19:16,215
Shut it down!

790
01:19:17,132 --> 01:19:19,551
Shut it down forever.

791
01:19:34,191 --> 01:19:35,275
What are you doing?

792
01:19:36,193 --> 01:19:40,864
They want to imprint you with
their own collective memories.

793
01:19:41,990 --> 01:19:44,201
They want to make you
one of them...

794
01:19:44,243 --> 01:19:46,411
so they can share your soul.

795
01:19:46,453 --> 01:19:48,789
But I've got other plans.

796
01:19:52,167 --> 01:19:55,045
Imprint, Doctor.
No more disobedience.

797
01:19:55,087 --> 01:19:59,758
I'm sorry. The pain will
only last a moment.

798
01:20:10,853 --> 01:20:12,563
Remember, John.

799
01:20:13,564 --> 01:20:15,607
You'll rise to greater heights
than that.

800
01:20:15,649 --> 01:20:18,110
One day when you're older,
you'll understand.

801
01:20:19,444 --> 01:20:20,404
Remember.

802
01:20:21,780 --> 01:20:24,616
That's it, John.
Practice makes perfect.

803
01:20:24,658 --> 01:20:27,911
Now, remember what I told you.
Never talk to strangers.

804
01:20:28,287 --> 01:20:29,621
John, remember.

805
01:20:29,830 --> 01:20:32,624
You're probably wondering why I
keep appearing in your memories.

806
01:20:32,666 --> 01:20:35,085
It's because I have
inserted myself in them.

807
01:20:35,127 --> 01:20:39,131
They were fabricated to
teach you about the Strangers.

808
01:20:39,131 --> 01:20:42,301
Give you a lifetime of knowledge
in a single syringe.

809
01:20:45,137 --> 01:20:49,808
You will survive, John. You'll
find strength within yourself.

810
01:20:49,850 --> 01:20:51,351
And you will prevail.

811
01:20:52,019 --> 01:20:53,187
Remember.

812
01:20:53,896 --> 01:20:56,106
-Hi, Uncle Karl.
-Johnny!

813
01:20:59,026 --> 01:21:03,155
Getting the hang of it, John.
Maybe one day I'll work for you.

814
01:21:03,780 --> 01:21:07,409
Here's the machine the Strangers
use to amplify their thoughts,

815
01:21:07,451 --> 01:21:09,203
the machine that changes
their world.

816
01:21:09,244 --> 01:21:12,497
You must take control of it.
You must make the machine yours.

817
01:21:12,539 --> 01:21:17,169
I know you can beat them,
but you must concentrate.

818
01:21:19,171 --> 01:21:20,380
Something's wrong.

819
01:21:29,223 --> 01:21:31,058
There is no time for romance.

820
01:21:31,099 --> 01:21:33,227
The world can be
what you make it.

821
01:21:34,228 --> 01:21:35,270
What have you done?

822
01:21:36,355 --> 01:21:38,482
You have the power
to make anything happen...

823
01:21:38,565 --> 01:21:40,484
but you must act now.

824
01:26:24,810 --> 01:26:29,022
I knew you could do it, John.
You have their power now.

825
01:26:29,106 --> 01:26:31,358
-You control their machines.
-Where's Emma?

826
01:26:32,526 --> 01:26:36,947
She's not Emma anymore.
She has been reimprinted.

827
01:26:36,947 --> 01:26:39,283
-So give her back her memories.
-I can't.

828
01:26:39,324 --> 01:26:43,412
The facility where they stored
the memories has been destroyed.

829
01:26:44,204 --> 01:26:45,205
I'm sorry.

830
01:26:46,623 --> 01:26:48,584
What are you going to do now?

831
01:26:51,587 --> 01:26:53,088
I'm gonna fix things.

832
01:26:54,715 --> 01:26:58,010
You told me I had the power,
didn't you?

833
01:26:59,011 --> 01:27:01,930
I can make these machines
do anything I want.

834
01:27:03,015 --> 01:27:05,058
Make this world
anything I want it to be.

835
01:27:06,268 --> 01:27:10,314
Just so long as I concentrate
hard enough.

836
01:28:33,981 --> 01:28:35,232
Where are you going?

837
01:28:38,694 --> 01:28:39,695
Shell Beach.

838
01:29:21,028 --> 01:29:22,529
-What's the fare?
-A quarter.

839
01:29:29,328 --> 01:29:31,079
-Please.
-Oh, no, sit.

840
01:29:32,372 --> 01:29:33,373
Thank you.

841
01:30:19,378 --> 01:30:21,380
Been waiting for you, yes?

842
01:30:22,047 --> 01:30:26,385
-What are you doing?
-I'm just making a few changes.

843
01:30:26,385 --> 01:30:31,306
-We're sure that's what we want?
-I'll take my chances.

844
01:30:31,390 --> 01:30:37,145
I'm dying, John. Your imprint
is not agreeable with my kind.

845
01:30:37,229 --> 01:30:39,356
But I wanted to know
what it was like.

846
01:30:41,066 --> 01:30:42,693
How you feel.

847
01:30:42,776 --> 01:30:45,445
You know how I was
supposed to feel.

848
01:30:45,487 --> 01:30:49,575
That person isn't me.
Never was.

849
01:30:49,616 --> 01:30:52,828
You wanted to know what it was
that makes us human.

850
01:30:53,912 --> 01:30:57,749
Well, you're not going to
find it in here.

851
01:30:59,334 --> 01:31:01,128
You went looking
in the wrong place.

852
01:32:40,394 --> 01:32:42,187
It's so beautiful here.

853
01:32:47,568 --> 01:32:48,861
So bright.

854
01:32:55,158 --> 01:32:57,202
Do you know if Shell Beach
is around here?

855
01:32:57,953 --> 01:33:00,330
I think that's it over there.

856
01:33:18,599 --> 01:33:20,601
I'm headed that way myself.

857
01:33:22,603 --> 01:33:23,937
Would you like to join me?

858
01:33:27,065 --> 01:33:28,025
Sure.

859
01:33:33,488 --> 01:33:37,034
I'm Anna, by the way.
What's your name?

860
01:33:37,242 --> 01:33:41,997
John..
John Murdoch.
